title: Rugby World Cup 2019: Wales confident Jonathan Davies will be fit for France quarter-final
text:
Wales are confident Jonathan Davies will be fit to face France in the World Cup quarter-finals.

The 31-year-old centre and star man in the Welsh side, knocked his knee when setting up Josh Adams' hat-trick try against Fiji.

He looked disconsolate as he left the field, but with a week until the first knockout match he is expected to make a recovery.

Wales are confident Jonathan Davies will be fit to face France in the World Cup quarter-finals

'The medics are working on him,' said defence coach Shaun Edwards.

'We don't feel like it's as bad as we first feared.

'There will be more news in a couple of days but the medics are working hard on him and we're in a positive frame of mind with regards to him being involved further down the line.'

Official statistics showed Wales missed 32 tackles against Fiji - but Edwards, quoting his analysts figures said it was 25.

Either way the figure was too high in his mind, although he noted - with Uruguay to play on Sunday and likely France in the quarter-final after that - Wales are unlikely to face such elusive athletes again.

The 31-year-old centre and star man in the Welsh side, knocked his knee against Fiji

'I looked and there were 16 missed tackles on both of their wingers who, let's be honest, are not the easiest human beings to tackle.

'If anyone has an A-Z on how to tackle Josua Tuisova, please send me it!

'Obviously there were too many (missed tackles).

'Having said that, looking at the rest of the competition, France also have incredibly talented individuals, similar athletes and we do need to improve that situation.

'Uruguay are a good attacking unit but we just have to turn up with the right attitude tomorrow and put in a performance that we can be proud of.'
